msItem.title: Dǝrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
msItem.incipit: Fol. 3r: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልደ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ [n.l.] ዘሥሩግ፡ በእንተ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት፡ ዘደረሰ፡ [ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡] ጸሎታ፡ ምስለ፡ [n.l.] ወልደ፡ ትንሣኤ [n.l.] …Fol. 3r: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit … which [Jaqob] of Serug, Orthodox in faith, composed on St. Sabbath of Christians … [May] her prayer be with … Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe …
msItem.explicit: Fol. 34v, l.21 – fol. 35r (l.7): ...ወአድኅነኒ፡ ወለዝንቱ፡ መጽ[fol. 35r]ሐፍ፡ ዘአጽሐፋ፡ ኅብኦ፡ እምሀከክ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ወልደ፡ ትንሣኤ፡ ዕቁባ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ላህየ፡ ድንግል፡ ወደቂቆሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ ማርያም፡ ሰሎሞን፡ ገብረ፡ ጊዮርጊስ። ወለጸሐፊሃኒ፡ ወልደ፡ ሙሴ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። Fol. 34v, l.21 – fol. 35r (l.7): ... And save me; and for the one who let this book be written, hide him from the commotion, namely ʾabunä Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe, ʿƎquba Libanos, Lahǝyä Dǝngǝl, Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Yoḥannǝs, Wälda Maryam, Sälomon, Gäbrä Giyorgis, and its scribe, Wäldä Muse, forever and ever. Amen.

colophon.foreign: Fol. 35r, l.7: (This) is the Homily of the Sabbath of (the church of) ʾabunä Libanos Mäsṭǝh, which ʾabunä Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe donated so that it would be the guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. O you, priests, don´t be idle each week [for] the Sabbath, sacred and glorious among all the days.

origin.origDate: This Ms. is not dated; however, it is possible to deduce the period of its production from the name of the scribe, Wäldä Muse (fol. 35r, l.6). The same name is mentioned in Ms. MR-023, which is dated between 1872 and 1876.

person.persName:
ʾabunä Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe (mentioned as the commissioner and donor on fol. 35r, l.2; cp. also fols. 3r, ls. 6-7; 5v, l.4; 10r, ls. 8-9; 22v, l.15; 25r, l.21; 32v, l.1; 35, ls. 2, 9). Besides, some other persons are mentioned: ʿƎquba Libanos (fols. 32v, l.2; 35r, ls. 2-3); Lahǝyä Dǝngǝl (fol. 35r, ls. 2-3); Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (fol. 35r, l.4); Wäldä Yoḥannǝs (fol. 35r, l.4); Wäldä Maryam (fol. 35r, ls. 4-5); Sälomon (fol. 35r, l.5); Gäbrä Giyorgis (fol. 35r, ls. 5-6).
Ms. MR-016 was commissioned by the same donors.
